subject: Olympic Games (1936)
Track and Field
Segregation
lead_paragraph: Mack Robinson, who finished second to Jesse Owens in the 200, came home to degradation in his home city of Pasadena, Calif. Martinus Osendarp, the Dutch sprinter who was third, wound up in prison for war crimes.
snippet: Mack Robinson, who finished second to Jesse Owens in the 200, came home to degradation in his home city of Pasadena, Calif. Martinus Osendarp, the Dutch sprinter who was third, wound up in prison for war crimes.
